title: 의학통계학(MED2104)
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  기술통계
text:
2.2 기술통계량

2.2.1 소숫점 셋째자리 반올림


2.2.2 Minimum

min(data$age)

[1] 20




2.2.3 Maximum

max(data$age)

[1] 80




2.2.4 Range

range(data$age)

[1] 20 80

range(data$age)[1]#min

[1] 20

range(data$age)[2]#max

[1] 80




2.2.5 Quantile

quantile(data$age,0.25)

  25% 
37.75 

quantile(data$age,0.75)

  75% 
65.25 




2.2.6 interquartile range

IQR(data$age)

[1] 27.5




2.2.7 Standard devidation

sd(data$age)

[1] 16.97444




2.2.8 Variance

var(data$age)

[1] 288.1317




2.2.9 Skewness

library(moments)
skewness(data$age)

[1] 0.02470892




2.2.10 Kurtosis

kurtosis(data$age)

[1] 1.940932



# summary: Min, 1st quartile, Median, Mean, 3rd quartile, Max
summary(data$age)

   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
  20.00   37.75   51.00   51.31   65.25   80.00 

# min: minimum
min(data$age)

[1] 20

# max: maximum
max(data$age)

[1] 80

# range: range = [min, max]
range(data$age)

[1] 20 80

# quantile: 
quantile(data$age, 0.25)

  25% 
37.75 

# IQR: interquartile range
IQR(data$age)

[1] 27.5

# Standard devidation: 
sd(data$age)

[1] 16.97444

# Variance: 
var(data$age)

[1] 288.1317

# Skewness
install.packages("moments", repos = 'http://cran.us.r-project.org')


다운로드된 바이너리 패키지들은 다음의 위치에 있습니다
    /var/folders/yp/03fysc6x5mqb63q6zm6wp_dm0000gn/T//Rtmp3eW7gY/downloaded_packages

library(moments)
skewness(data$age)

[1] 0.02470892

# Kurtosis
kurtosis(data$age)

[1] 1.940932




2.2.11 Stem and leaf plot

stem(data$age)


  The decimal point is 1 digit(s) to the right of the |

  2 | 001111122222222333333344444444
  2 | 55555555666666677788889999999
  3 | 0000000001111112222333333334444444444
  3 | 55555556666666666777777777777888888888999999999
  4 | 0000000000111111122222222223333333333344444444
  4 | 5555555555555556666677777777778888888999999999
  5 | 0000000000000111111111222222233333333333344444
  5 | 555555566666666666677777778888888888888888999999999
  6 | 000000011222222222223333333344444444444
  6 | 5555666666666667777777788888899999999999
  7 | 000011111112222223333334444444444
  7 | 5555556666666667778889999999999
  8 | 0000000000000000000000000




2.2.12 Histogram

hist(data$age)

library(ggplot2)



pp <- ggplot(data, aes(x=age)) + geom_histogram(binwidth=1, color="blue", fill="white")
pp






2.2.13 Box plot

boxplot(data$age)



library(ggplot2)
pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=age)) + geom_boxplot()
pp






2.2.14 Box plot 2 groups

boxplot(data$age~data$sex)



library(ggplot2)
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)
pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=sex, y= age)) + geom_boxplot()
pp

title: 3  확률과 분포
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 4  두 집단 평균비교
text:
4.1 Two sample t-test

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: carData

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)

# 1: Male, 2: Female
levels(data$sex)=c("Male","Female")

knitr::kable(head(data[,c("ID","sex","age","HE_sbp1","HE_sbp2")], 10))




ID
sex
age
HE_sbp1
HE_sbp2

pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=sex, y= age, fill=sex)) + geom_boxplot()
pp



# 등분산 가정 검토
leveneTest(age ~ sex, data=data, center = mean)

Levene's Test for Homogeneity of Variance (center = mean)
       Df F value Pr(>F)
group   1  1.2878  0.257
      498               

# 등분산 가정이 만족할 때
t.test(age~sex, data=data, var.equal = TRUE)


    Two Sample t-test

data:  age by sex
t = -1.6103, df = 498, p-value = 0.108
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means between group Male and group Female is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -5.482809  0.543606
sample estimates:
  mean in group Male mean in group Female 
            49.89151             52.36111 

# 등분산 가정이 만족하지 않을 때
t.test(age~sex, data=data, var.equal = FALSE)


    Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  age by sex
t = -1.598, df = 441.53, p-value = 0.1108
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means between group Male and group Female is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -5.5069652  0.5677619
sample estimates:
  mean in group Male mean in group Female 
            49.89151             52.36111

title: 4  두 집단 평균비교
text:
4.2 Paired t-test

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
t.test(data$HE_sbp1,data$HE_sbp2,paired=TRUE)


    Paired t-test

data:  data$HE_sbp1 and data$HE_sbp2
t = 3.3862, df = 497, p-value = 0.0007648
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.3574025 1.3454088
sample estimates:
mean difference 
      0.8514056

title: 4  두 집단 평균비교
text:
4.3 정규성 검정(Normality test)

4.3.1 Shapiro-Wilk test

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
shapiro.test(data$HE_sbp)


    Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  data$HE_sbp
W = 0.97678, p-value = 4.081e-07




4.3.2 정규Q-Q 도표(Normal Q-Q plot)

qqnorm(data$HE_sbp);qqline(data$HE_sbp)






4.3.3 Kolmogorov-Smirnov test

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
t.test(data$HE_sbp1,data$HE_sbp2,paired=TRUE)


    Paired t-test

data:  data$HE_sbp1 and data$HE_sbp2
t = 3.3862, df = 497, p-value = 0.0007648
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.3574025 1.3454088
sample estimates:
mean difference 
      0.8514056

title: 4  두 집단 평균비교
section: 4.4 Mann-Whitney U test (or Wilcoxon rank-sum test)
text:
4.4 Mann-Whitney U test (or Wilcoxon rank-sum test)

wilcox.test(age~sex, data = data)


    Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction

data:  age by sex
W = 27880, p-value = 0.09726
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0

title: 4  두 집단 평균비교
text:
4.5 Wilcoxon signed-rank test

wilcox.test(data$HE_sbp1, data$HE_sbp2, paired = TRUE)


    Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction

data:  data$HE_sbp1 and data$HE_sbp2
V = 47066, p-value = 0.000416
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0

title: 5  세 집단 이상 평균비교
text:
5.1 One-way ANOVA

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: carData

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)
# to generate BMI group variable
data$BMI_gp = ifelse(data$HE_BMI<20,"1 light",
                     ifelse(data$HE_BMI<25,"2 normal",
                            ifelse(data$HE_BMI>=25,"3 heavy",NA)))

# boxplot
pp <- ggplot(data,aes(x=BMI_gp, y= HE_sbp, fill=BMI_gp)) +
  geom_boxplot()
pp

Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_boxplot()`).




# ANOVA
rslt = aov(HE_sbp~BMI_gp,data=data)
summary(rslt)

             Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)   
BMI_gp        2   3021  1510.6   6.238 0.00211 **
Residuals   493 119379   242.1                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
결측으로 인하여 4개의 관측치가 삭제되었습니다.

# 4 observations deleted due to missingness
## is.na()
sum(is.na(data$HE_BMI))

[1] 3

table(data$BMI_gp)


 1 light 2 normal  3 heavy 
      61      280      156 

sum(is.na(data$HE_sbp))

[1] 2

data$HE_BMI[which(is.na(data$HE_sbp)==TRUE)]

[1]       NA 32.98484

title: 5  세 집단 이상 평균비교
text:
5.2 Multiple comparison (Bonferroni procedure)

pairwise.t.test(data$age, data$BMI_gp, p.adj = "bonf")


    Pairwise comparisons using t tests with pooled SD 

data:  data$age and data$BMI_gp 

         1 light 2 normal
2 normal 0.059   -       
3 heavy  0.037   1.000   

P value adjustment method: bonferroni 

# cf. not adjust p-value result
pairwise.t.test(data$age, data$BMI_gp, p.adj = "none")


    Pairwise comparisons using t tests with pooled SD 

data:  data$age and data$BMI_gp 

         1 light 2 normal
2 normal 0.020   -       
3 heavy  0.012   0.628   

P value adjustment method: none 

data2 = subset(data,BMI_gp %in%c("light","normal"))

title: 5  세 집단 이상 평균비교
text:
5.3 Multiple comparison (TukeyHSD)

TukeyHSD(rslt)

  Tukey multiple comparisons of means
    95% family-wise confidence level

Fit: aov(formula = HE_sbp ~ BMI_gp, data = data)

$BMI_gp
                     diff         lwr       upr     p adj
2 normal-1 light 5.199297  0.03047092 10.368124 0.0482873
3 heavy-1 light  8.224643  2.69553842 13.753748 0.0014871
3 heavy-2 normal 3.025346 -0.63699271  6.687684 0.1281154

title: 5  세 집단 이상 평균비교
text:
5.4 Kruskal-Wallis test

kruskal.test(HE_sbp~BMI_gp,data=data)


    Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test

data:  HE_sbp by BMI_gp
Kruskal-Wallis chi-squared = 15.849, df = 2, p-value = 0.0003617

title: 5  세 집단 이상 평균비교
text:
5.5 Dunn procedure

library(FSA)

Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'FSA':
  method       from
  confint.boot car 
  hist.boot    car 


## FSA v0.9.5. See citation('FSA') if used in publication.
## Run fishR() for related website and fishR('IFAR') for related book.



다음의 패키지를 부착합니다: 'FSA'


The following object is masked from 'package:car':

    bootCase

dunnTest(HE_sbp~BMI_gp,data=data, method = "bonferroni")

Warning: BMI_gp was coerced to a factor.


Warning: Some rows deleted from 'x' and 'g' because missing data.


Dunn (1964) Kruskal-Wallis multiple comparison


  p-values adjusted with the Bonferroni method.


          Comparison         Z      P.unadj        P.adj
1 1 light - 2 normal -2.812301 4.918837e-03 0.0147565123
2  1 light - 3 heavy -3.964764 7.346848e-05 0.0002204054
3 2 normal - 3 heavy -2.016553 4.374220e-02 0.1312266133

title: 6  두 집단의 분율비교
text:
6.1 Chi-square test

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: carData

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)
levels(data$sex)=c("Male","Female")
data$DE1_dg = as.factor(data$DE1_dg)
levels(data$DE1_dg) = c("No", "Yes")
table(data$sex,data$DE1_dg)

        
          No Yes
  Male   189  23
  Female 259  29

round(prop.table(table(data$sex,data$DE1_dg),1),3)

        
            No   Yes
  Male   0.892 0.108
  Female 0.899 0.101

chisq.test(table(data$sex,data$DE1_dg),correct=FALSE)# Asymptotic significance


    Pearson's Chi-squared test

data:  table(data$sex, data$DE1_dg)
X-squared = 0.079648, df = 1, p-value = 0.7778

chisq.test(table(data$sex,data$DE1_dg),correct=TRUE)# Continuity Correction


    Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  table(data$sex, data$DE1_dg)
X-squared = 0.017955, df = 1, p-value = 0.8934

title: 6  두 집단의 분율비교
text:
6.2 Fisher’s exact test

data$cursmoke = as.factor(data$cursmoke)
levels(data$cursmoke) = c("No", "Yes")
table(data$cursmoke,data$DE1_dg)

     
       No Yes
  No  373  43
  Yes  75   9

round(prop.table(table(data$cursmoke,data$DE1_dg),1),3)

     
         No   Yes
  No  0.897 0.103
  Yes 0.893 0.107

chisq.test(table(data$cursmoke,data$DE1_dg),correct=FALSE)# Asymptotic significance


    Pearson's Chi-squared test

data:  table(data$cursmoke, data$DE1_dg)
X-squared = 0.010702, df = 1, p-value = 0.9176

chisq.test(table(data$cursmoke,data$DE1_dg),correct=TRUE)# Continuity Correction


    Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  table(data$cursmoke, data$DE1_dg)
X-squared = 3.1536e-30, df = 1, p-value = 1

fisher.test(table(data$cursmoke,data$DE1_dg))# Fisher's exact test


    Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data

data:  table(data$cursmoke, data$DE1_dg)
p-value = 0.847
alternative hypothesis: true odds ratio is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.427615 2.284097
sample estimates:
odds ratio 
   1.04085

title: 6  두 집단의 분율비교
text:
6.3 Mantel-Haenszel chi-square test

library(DescTools)


다음의 패키지를 부착합니다: 'DescTools'


The following object is masked from 'package:car':

    Recode

data$BMI_gp = ifelse(data$HE_BMI<=20, 1,
                     ifelse(data$HE_BMI<=25,2,
                            ifelse(data$HE_BMI>25,3,NA)))
data$BMI_gp = as.factor(data$BMI_gp)
levels(data$BMI_gp) = c("light","normal","heavy")
table(data$DI1_dg,data$BMI_gp)

   
    light normal heavy
  0    53    220   104
  1     8     60    52

chisq.test(table(data$DI1_dg,data$BMI_gp))


    Pearson's Chi-squared test

data:  table(data$DI1_dg, data$BMI_gp)
X-squared = 12.371, df = 2, p-value = 0.002059

MHChisqTest(table(data$DI1_dg,data$BMI_gp))


    Mantel-Haenszel Chi-Square

data:  table(data$DI1_dg, data$BMI_gp)
X-squared = 12.157, df = 1, p-value = 0.0004891

title: 6  두 집단의 분율비교
text:
6.4 McNemar test

data$sbp_group1 = ifelse(data$HE_sbp1<=120,"normal",
                         ifelse(data$HE_sbp1>120,"danger",NA))
data$sbp_group2 = ifelse(data$HE_sbp2<=120,"normal",
                         ifelse(data$HE_sbp2>120,"danger",NA))
table(data$sbp_group1,data$sbp_group2)

        
         danger normal
  danger    199     27
  normal     22    250

mcnemar.test(table(data$sbp_group1,data$sbp_group2),correct=F)


    McNemar's Chi-squared test

data:  table(data$sbp_group1, data$sbp_group2)
McNemar's chi-squared = 0.5102, df = 1, p-value = 0.4751

mcnemar.test(table(data$sbp_group1,data$sbp_group2),correct=T)


    McNemar's Chi-squared test with continuity correction

data:  table(data$sbp_group1, data$sbp_group2)
McNemar's chi-squared = 0.32653, df = 1, p-value = 0.5677

title: 6  두 집단의 분율비교
text:
6.5 Weight cases example

test_data = matrix(c(2,28,5,25),nrow=2,ncol=2,byrow = T)
test_data

     [,1] [,2]
[1,]    2   28
[2,]    5   25

fisher.test(test_data)


    Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data

data:  test_data
p-value = 0.4238
alternative hypothesis: true odds ratio is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.03189243 2.46223985
sample estimates:
odds ratio 
 0.3630951

title: 7  회귀분석
text:
7.1 Pearson’s correlation & Spearman correlation

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: carData

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")
data$sex = as.factor(data$sex)
plot(data$HE_BMI,data$HE_sbp)



pp <- ggplot(data=data, aes(x=HE_BMI, y=HE_sbp)) + geom_point()
pp

Warning: Removed 4 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).




# parametric correlation
cor.test(data$HE_BMI, data$HE_sbp, method = "pearson")


    Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  data$HE_BMI and data$HE_sbp
t = 2.8147, df = 494, p-value = 0.005077
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.03801333 0.21134263
sample estimates:
      cor 
0.1256366 

# non-parametric correlation
cor.test(data$HE_BMI, data$HE_sbp, method = "spearman")

Warning in cor.test.default(data$HE_BMI, data$HE_sbp, method = "spearman"):
tie때문에 정확한 p값을 계산할 수 없습니다



    Spearman's rank correlation rho

data:  data$HE_BMI and data$HE_sbp
S = 16895709, p-value = 0.0001527
alternative hypothesis: true rho is not equal to 0
sample estimates:
      rho 
0.1692231

F-statistic: 20.93 on 5 and 477 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16

title: 8  로지스틱 회귀분석
text:
8.1 subset

library(haven)
library(ggplot2)
library(car)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: carData

data = read_sav("HN19_실습.sav")

final_data = subset(data,select=c("sex","age","HE_sbp","HE_chol","HE_TG","smoke","DI1_dg"))
final_data$sex = as.factor(final_data$sex)
levels(final_data$sex) = c("Male", "Female")
final_data$smoke = as.factor(final_data$smoke)
levels(final_data$smoke) = c("current", "ex smoker", "non smoker")
final_data$smoke = relevel(final_data$smoke, ref = "current")
knitr::kable(head(final_data,10))

title: 8  로지스틱 회귀분석
text:
8.2 Logistic regression

library(glmnet)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: Matrix


Loaded glmnet 4.1-7

final_data = final_data[complete.cases(final_data),]
final_data$DI1_dg = as.factor(final_data$DI1_dg)
fit.logistic = glm(DI1_dg~age+sex+HE_sbp+HE_chol+HE_TG+smoke,
                   data = final_data,
                   family = "binomial")
summary(fit.logistic)


Call:
glm(formula = DI1_dg ~ age + sex + HE_sbp + HE_chol + HE_TG + 
    smoke, family = "binomial", data = final_data)

Coefficients:
                 Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept)     -6.198749   1.328036  -4.668 3.05e-06 ***
age              0.071630   0.010021   7.148 8.82e-13 ***
sexFemale        0.093012   0.376073   0.247 0.804657    
HE_sbp           0.025977   0.008968   2.897 0.003771 ** 
HE_chol         -0.012808   0.003755  -3.411 0.000647 ***
HE_TG            0.002072   0.001506   1.376 0.168762    
smokeex smoker  -0.094936   0.418377  -0.227 0.820490    
smokenon smoker -0.129367   0.448355  -0.289 0.772935    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 533.08  on 483  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 381.04  on 476  degrees of freedom
AIC: 397.04

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 5

round(cbind(exp(coef(fit.logistic)),exp(confint(fit.logistic))),3)

title: 8  로지스틱 회귀분석
text:
8.3 AUC, Area Under the Curve

library(pROC)

Type 'citation("pROC")' for a citation.



다음의 패키지를 부착합니다: 'pROC'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    cov, smooth, var

library(generalhoslem)

필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: reshape



다음의 패키지를 부착합니다: 'reshape'


The following object is masked from 'package:Matrix':

    expand


필요한 패키지를 로딩중입니다: MASS

# predicted probabilities
pred_y = predict(fit.logistic, data = final_data, type="response")
# ROC curve
plot.roc(final_data$DI1_dg,pred_y)

Setting levels: control = 0, case = 1


Setting direction: controls < cases




auc(final_data$DI1_dg,pred_y)

Setting levels: control = 0, case = 1
Setting direction: controls < cases


Area under the curve: 0.854

# Hosmer-Lemeshow test
## 결과 재확인 필요(2023.08.29)
logitgof(final_data$DI1_dg,fitted(fit.logistic))

Warning in logitgof(final_data$DI1_dg, fitted(fit.logistic)): At least one cell
in the expected frequencies table is < 1. Chi-square approximation may be
incorrect.



    Hosmer and Lemeshow test (binary model)

data:  final_data$DI1_dg, fitted(fit.logistic)
X-squared = 6.9265, df = 8, p-value = 0.5446

title: 9  생존분석
text:
9.4 Cox proportional hazard model

# to generate BMI group variable
final_data$BMI_gp = ifelse(final_data$HE_BMI<=22,"1 light",
                     ifelse(final_data$HE_BMI<=26,"2 normal",
                            ifelse(final_data$HE_BMI>26,"3 heavy",NA)))
#final_data$BMI_gp = relevel(final_data$BMI_gp, ref = "3 heavy")
cox.fit <- coxph(Surv(DI1_ag, DI1_dg) ~ age+sex+HE_chol+BMI_gp, data=final_data)
summary(cox.fit)

Call:
coxph(formula = Surv(DI1_ag, DI1_dg) ~ age + sex + HE_chol + 
    BMI_gp, data = final_data)

  n= 341, number of events= 114 
   (결측으로 인하여 16개의 관측치가 삭제되었습니다.)

                    coef exp(coef)  se(coef)      z Pr(>|z|)    
age            -0.044977  0.956020  0.012150 -3.702 0.000214 ***
sex             0.085525  1.089289  0.195786  0.437 0.662236    
HE_chol        -0.010243  0.989809  0.002706 -3.786 0.000153 ***
BMI_gp2 normal -0.059136  0.942578  0.239266 -0.247 0.804787    
BMI_gp3 heavy   0.595202  1.813397  0.251939  2.362 0.018153 *  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

               exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95
age               0.9560     1.0460    0.9335    0.9791
sex               1.0893     0.9180    0.7421    1.5988
HE_chol           0.9898     1.0103    0.9846    0.9951
BMI_gp2 normal    0.9426     1.0609    0.5897    1.5065
BMI_gp3 heavy     1.8134     0.5515    1.1067    2.9713

Concordance= 0.687  (se = 0.026 )
Likelihood ratio test= 32.49  on 5 df,   p=5e-06
Wald test            = 31.79  on 5 df,   p=7e-06
Score (logrank) test = 31.93  on 5 df,   p=6e-06
